munchlax.lib.group module¶

class munchlax.lib.group.Group(slack, group)[source]¶

Bases: munchlax.lib.object.Object

archive()[source]¶

Archives the group.

Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
close()[source]¶

Closes the group.

Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
create_child()[source]¶

Clones the group and then archives the original.

Returns:
A Group object that is a clone of the original
group.
Return type:Group
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
get_history(**kwargs)[source]¶

Fetches and returns the message history for the group.

Parameters:
  • **kwargs – Arbitrary options to use when fetching
  • group's message history. Refer to Slack#get_group_history (the) –
  • more information. (for) –
  • is mostly a convenience method so you can directly fetch (This) –
  • group's message history. (a) –
Returns:

A list of Message objects. bool: Whether or not there are more messages in the group’s history.
Return type:

list (Message)
Raises:

SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
get_replies(ts)[source]¶

Fetches and returns all replies to a message within the group.

Parameters:ts – The timestamp of the parent message to look for.
Returns:
A list of Message objects representing a message
thread.
Return type:list (Message)
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
invite_user(user)[source]¶

Invites a user to the group.

Parameters:user (User) – The user to invite to the group.
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
join()[source]¶

Joins the group.

In the event that the group is already joined, then True is returned instead of a Group object for the joined group.

Parameters:group (group) – The group to join. This group must not be private.
Returns:
If the user has not yet joined this group
then a Group object representing the newly joined group will be returned.

If the group to join has already been joined, then True will be returned instead.
Return type:group
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
kick_user(user)[source]¶

Kicks a user from the group.

Parameters:user (User) – The user to kick from the group.
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
leave()[source]¶

Leaves the group.

Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
list_members()[source]¶

Fetches and returns a list of all group members.

Returns:All members in the group.
Return type:list<Member>
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
mark(ts)[source]¶

Changes the last-read indicator in the group for the current user.

Parameters:ts (float) – The timestamp to use when changing the last-read indicator.
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
open()[source]¶

Opens the group channel.

Raise:
SlackError: Raised in the vent that Slack does not return “ok”.
rename(name, validate=False)[source]¶

Renames the group to something else.

This method causes the current Group object to become stale.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – The new name for the group.
  • validate (bool) –

    Whether or not to return an error instead of changing the new name to be valid.

    Defaults to False.
Returns:

The new name for the group.
Return type:

str
Raises:

SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
set_purpose(purpose)[source]¶

Sets the purpose for the group.

This causes the Group object being worked on to become stale.

Parameters:purpose – The purpose to use when updating the group.
Returns:The new purpose of the group.
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
set_topic(topic)[source]¶

Sets the topic for the group.

This causes the Group object being worked on to become stale.

Parameters:topic – The topic to use when updating the group.
Returns:The new topic of the group.
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
unarchive()[source]¶

Unarchives the group.

Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
update()[source]¶

Updates the current Group object. There isn’t much benefit to using this and it’s here if you don’t want to replace your current Group object or can’t.

Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
upload(**kwargs)[source]¶

Uploads a file to the group.

Parameters:**kwargs –

Arbitrary options to use when uploading the file. Refer to Slack#upload_file for more information.

This is mostly a convenience method so you can directly upload files through a Group object.
Returns:A File object representing the newly uploaded file.
Return type:File
Raises:SlackError – Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
write(text, **kwargs)[source]¶

Writes a message to the group.

Parameters:
  • text (str) – The text of the message.
  • **kwargs –

    Additional options to use when sending the message. Refer to Slack#raw_write for more information.

    In most cases, you will only need to specify text if you only want to send a text message.
Returns:

A Message object representing the newly sent message.
Return type:

Message
Raise:
SlackError: Raised in the event that Slack does not return “ok”.
